intro: Xanthisma coloradoense, commonly known as Colorado sandgrass, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in desert or semi-desert environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Xanthisma coloradoense produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
